summary: made sort of a collab with a person on twitter (they wrote the story, i provided them with pics), follow them, please...
body:
made sort of a collab with a person on twitter (they wrote the story, i provided them with pics), follow them, please (@QUIZN_K)

since i’m a non-english person all it’s written in russian. here’s translation:

Crowley: How do you like this, babe?

Aziraphale: Ahhh~ So delicious… Mhmm…

Crowley: Do you want more? You’re gluttonous angel…

Aziraphale: OH GOD YES!

Gabriel: WHAT ARE YOU DOING TO THE INNOCENT ANGEL YOU FILTHY PERVERTED DEMON!

Crowley: WHAT’D YOU CALL ME?!

and yeah, look who’s alive

title: Make Me Live
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2MQeRyM

by nairwal

“As far as their friendship goes, this is a common occurrence. Crowley will come up with plans and force them onto Aziraphale whether he wishes to take part or not. He will seek Aziraphale out in this classroom, or the Great Hall during supper, or in his own private quarters… He would not do half of the things Crowley suggested if he were not so… Crowley.”

For Aziraphale, this is just another year at Hogwarts. Crowley seems intent on proving him wrong.

summary:
Crowley: I am offended. I am angry. I am very tired...
Crowley: So I’m going to take a nap, but when I wake up, oh you are in...
body:
Crowley: I am offended. I am angry. I am very tired…

Crowley: So I’m going to take a nap, but when I wake up, oh you are in for it.

[four hours later]

Crowley: How dare you?

[four hours later]

summary: I’m currently reading Neil Gaiman’s Good Omens script book and I am thoroughly enjoying it, especially these directions and...
body:
I’m currently reading Neil Gaiman’s Good Omens script book and I am thoroughly enjoying it, especially these directions and little notes sprinkled about. Here are my favorites:

The nanny, wearing dark glasses, reminds us of Crowley. She’s sexy and domineering.

The plants are terrified. No, I don’t know how we show this on television either.

Crowley flares at him, glarefully.

HUGE EXPLOSION. FIRE AND LIGHT AND THINGS BEING BLOWN AROUND. SO COOL AN EXPLOSION THAT I AM TYPING IN CAPITALS.

Crowley’s bedroom. We see a montage of Crowley trying to get to sleep by lying on the bed, on the wall, then on the ceiling. CLOSE UP of his snake-eyes. He’s wide-awake. Then he puts on his dark glasses.

Can someone please draw Crowley attempting to fall asleep in all of those places and then calling Aziraphale to meet up at their third (romantic) rendezvous!!!

summary: The look on Aziraphale's face when he's complaining about the paint though. He's absolutely asking Crowley to do something about...

You need to rest, said me, clicking next episodes of every fandom videos i watch at 2 am.

tags: Is this canon or not i dont know it was just crossed in my mind
body:
WHAT IF

When crowley and aziraphale spent 6 hours drink till they drunk, and also when Crowley says “My point is.. my point is..” he wanted to say something to aziraphale, morelike he misses him or like how good aziraphale is after their last separated? but his consciousness didnt let him say his true intentions, so instead he says ‘Dolphins’

tags: ms doing the lords work with all that crowley/aziraphale
summary:
It cracks me up so much just how perfect opposites David Tennant and Michael Sheen are from aziraphale and Crowley like
You’d...
body:
It cracks me up so much just how perfect opposites David Tennant and Michael Sheen are from aziraphale and Crowley like

You’d expect Crowley the good ole demon to be full of sin and lust and what not and I mean he probs is but then you got David Tennant who doesn’t know what the aubergine emoji even means

And THEN you have aziraphale, holier than thou perfect sinless angel who after 6000 years of slow burn still thinks that Crowley goes “too fast” whos played by the absolute madman “i bought my coworker a sausage grinder” “i think that Crowley and aziraphale fuck” “i know that there are some pretty steamy stories about our characters online” “add the peach and the rain drops” “I had to ride this actor like a wild stallion” Michael Sheen

reblog.comment:

And THEN you have aziraphale, holier than thou perfect sinless angel who after 6000 years of slow burn still thinks that Crowley goes “too fast” whos played by the absolute madman “i bought my coworker a sausage grinder” “i think that Crowley and aziraphale fuck” “i know that there are some pretty steamy stories about our characters online” “add the peach and the rain drops” “I had to ride this actor like a wild stallion” Michael Sheen

It cracks me up so much just how perfect opposites David Tennant and Michael Sheen are from aziraphale and Crowley like

You’d expect Crowley the good ole demon to be full of sin and lust and what not and I mean he probs is but then you got David Tennant who doesn’t know what the aubergine emoji even means

And THEN you have aziraphale, holier than thou perfect sinless angel who after 6000 years of slow burn still thinks that Crowley goes “too fast” whos played by the absolute madman “i bought my coworker a sausage grinder” “i think that Crowley and aziraphale fuck” “i know that there are some pretty steamy stories about our characters online” “add the peach and the rain drops” “I had to ride this actor like a wild stallion” Michael Sheen
trail.content:
It cracks me up so much just how perfect opposites David Tennant and Michael Sheen are from aziraphale and Crowley like

You’d expect Crowley the good ole demon to be full of sin and lust and what not and I mean he probs is but then you got David Tennant who doesn’t know what the aubergine emoji even means

And THEN you have aziraphale, holier than thou perfect sinless angel who after 6000 years of slow burn still thinks that Crowley goes “too fast” whos played by the absolute madman “i bought my coworker a sausage grinder” “i think that Crowley and aziraphale fuck” “i know that there are some pretty steamy stories about our characters online” “add the peach and the rain drops” “I had to ride this actor like a wild stallion” Michael Sheen

title: aesthetics
body:
book aziraphale: fine silks with old-fashioned patterns, neatly pressed and ironed, their soft sheen catching the light; a cold, calculating stare quickly aimed at an unlucky prospective customer; a full-bodied dessert wine that lingers thick and sweet on the tongue, the picture of indulgence; plump hands, warm and exquisitely gentle, cherishing the book in their hands and delicately turning its pages; the scent of dust and mould, thick on the air, but underneath the scent of book after book after book; an armchair so comfortable that stuffing splits from its well-worn seams, so ancient the tartan pattern at its cushion has faded into vague red lines; the sound of a teaspoon clinking in a cocoa cup; a small, smug laugh, hidden behind well-manicured fingers; a kiss laid sweetly upon an infernal brow. 
book crowley: the flicker of a forked tongue from behind neat, handsome teeth, the lisp almost swallowed while it wraps itself around everyday speech; sleek, black suits with dazzlingly sharp lines, and shoes that aren't shoes at all; an amused murmur to one's companion, and the momentary pleasure of sharing judgement on another; tasting everything in the smallest amounts, then sliding the full plate to your partner; the scent of a subtle cologne, long-since discontinued, and yet so enchanting you turn your head in its direction; the taste of black coffee on the air; sleek, smart gadgets that fit in one's pocket; the scent of deerskin driving gloves, beautiful and tailored to the hand; a sofa in black and white, the sound of the 'golden girls' chattering away on television as a softly hissing snore is muffled against the leather; a kiss laid with faux-lascivious pleasure upon the back of a heavenly hand. 
tv aziraphale: a beautiful suit worn in by the decades, the scent of cologne lingering on the fabric, worn in places, lovingly repaired in others; a gentle smile at the ring of the shop bell, a graceful turn of the head; the scent of fresh cakes and sugar on the air; the pleasant weight of the telephone in hand as it comes away from the cradle, the familiar click of the rotary dial beneath a clever finger; soft, shy smiles, and searching fingers that brush against another's hand, one you don't quite have the courage to grasp; schubert, hummed softly under the breath as one moves between the shelves and settles all the books neatly back into place; the sensation of the ring, the natural spouse of its infernal counterpart, as it is anxiously turned on the finger by a well-manicured thumb. 
tv crowley: tight-fitting clothes that were cool in some unknown yesteryear; hair that is red and soft under the fingers, a handsome hand brushing artfully through it; the taste of chocolate, rich and sweetened where it hits the tongue; concrete walls and minimalist furniture, gilded in gold and ostentatious in its scarcity; the scent of myriad wines, recanted into bottles and yet to be re-corked; the confident click-click of sauntering steps in a tiled corridor; the soft sigh as the body sprawls in its seat, one leg raised, a natural temptation; the thick, fraught air that comes before the thunder breaks the tension; a ring worn on a chain around the neck, matched to some heavenly partner.

dialogue.name: book aziraphale
dialogue.label: book aziraphale:
